name: PRIMED Phenotype Data Model
description: Data model for phenotype data in the PRIMED consortium

columns.description: subject/participant Identifier within project
subject identifier used by dbGaP (if available)
consent abbreviation (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4721915/table/pgen.1005772.t001/?report=objectonly)
short name for study as defined by CC
flag if subject has been submitted to dbGaP
PHS ID for study
reported sex

columns.notes: overlap with omop-person

columns.description: a concept or classification scheme that categorizes people into groups (or “populations”) according to a perceived characteristic or dimension of interest
columns.notes: delimited list (delim is '|'). race and ethnicity info are in the omop-person table

columns.description: name given to a population that describes or classifies it according to the dimension along which it was identified
columns.notes: delimited list same length as population_descriptor (delim is '|')
AnVIL requires entity id with naming convention <table_name>_id

columns.description: md5 checksum for the file
absolute file path in cloud storage
path to the README
Number of unique subjects in file
Number of rows in file (may be > n_subjects for longitudinal data)
data model version for this table
columns.notes: added automatically by validation workflow
AnVIL requires entity id with naming convention <table_name>_id

path to the data dictionary

columns.notes: references subject_id in subject table

columns.description: human epidermal growth factor receptor 2
progesterone receptor breast cancer cells
estrogen receptor breast cancer cells

staging (clinical, pathological) is uknown
